snippet: The battle of the bins, that preflight scrum over carry-on space, has become something else for airlines: the business of the bins, with priority given to those who pay.
abstract: Airlines are finding new ways to make money from carry-on luggage by increasingly giving priority to those travelers who pay; fact that airlines now charge fees for checking baggage has greatly increased number of bags that people carry onto planes, motivating many passengers to pay to board early and get first crack at storage.
lead_paragraph: The battle of the bins, that preflight scrum over carry-on space, has become something else for airlines: the business of the bins, with priority given to those who pay.

headline.main: Airlines Cash In on Every Inch, Even the Jammed Bins Overhead
headline.print_headline: Airlines Cash In on Every Inch, Even the Jammed Bins Overhead
